required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Metaphyseal Hip Prosthesis - Total Hip
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation of the Safety and Efficiency of the Metaphyseal Hip Prosthesis - Total Hip Arthroplasty

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to analyze stability, safety and efficacy of the Metaphyseal Hip Prosthesis (MHP) compared to the Stanmore hip replacement.

detailed_description.textblock:
The purpose of this study is to analyze stability, safety and efficacy of the Metaphyseal Hip Prosthesis (MHP) compared to the Stanmore hip replacement at short term (1 year) and long term (10 years).
Bone remodeling will be analyzed at 10 years using DEXA (Dual Energy X-Ray Absorptiometry (bone scan test)) measurements.
This is a single-center prospective study with 25 patients in the study and 25 in the control group in open Randomized Clinical Trial.

primary_outcome.time_frame: 3 months, 6 months, 1 year and 2 years postoperatively
primary_outcome.description: Stem movement measured with RSA (radiostereometric analysis) along the x-axis in mm. RSA is a technique to accurately measure 3D movement of the prosthesis in the bone. The movement is measured with respect to the situation directly postoperative.

primary_outcome.time_frame: 3 months, 6 months, 1 year and 2 years postoperatively
primary_outcome.description: Stem movement along the y-axis in mm. (measured with RSA)

primary_outcome.time_frame: 3 months, 6 months, 1 year and 2 years postoperatively
primary_outcome.description: Stem movement along z-axis in mm (measured with RSA)

primary_outcome.time_frame: 3 months, 6 months, 1 year and 2 years postoperatively
primary_outcome.description: Stem Rotation around X-axis in degrees (measured with RSA)

primary_outcome.time_frame: 3 months, 6 months, 1 year and 2 years postoperatively
primary_outcome.description: Stem rotation around the y-axis in degrees ( measured with RSA)

primary_outcome.time_frame: 3 months, 6 months, 1 year and 2 years postoperatively
primary_outcome.description: Stem rotation around the z-axis in degrees (measured with RSA)

primary_outcome.time_frame: 3 months, 6 months, 1 year and 2 years postoperatively
primary_outcome.description: Maximum Total Point Motion (MTPM) measured with RSA. This is a mean for the total migration of the stem.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Reported Device Related Complications
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 6 weeks, 3 months, 6 months, 1 year and 2 years postoperatively
secondary_outcome.description: Safety: - Frequency of serious device related complications.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: pre-operatively, 6 weeks, 3 months, 6 months, 1 year and 2 years postoperatively
secondary_outcome.description: Harris Hip Score (HHS), a score to measure health and satisfaction after a hip prosthesis. The score has a maximum of 100 points (best possible outcome) covering pain (1 item, 0-44 points), function (7 items, 0-47 points), absence of deformity (1 item, 4 points), and range of motion (2 items, 5 points)
Efficacy: Bone density measured using DEXA

secondary_outcome.time_frame: pre-operatively, 6 weeks, 3 months, 6 months, 1 year and 2 years postoperatively
secondary_outcome.description: HOOS (Hip disability and Osteoarthritis Outcome Score) consists of 5 subscales; Pain, other Symptoms, Function in daily living (ADL), Function in sport and recreation (Sport/Rec) and hip related Quality of life (QOL). The last week is taken into consideration when answering the questions. Standardized answer options are given (5 Likert boxes) and each question gets a score from 0 to 4. A normalized score (100 indicating no symptoms and 0 indicating extreme symptoms) is calculated for each subscale.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: pre-operatively, 6 weeks, 3 months, 6 months, 1 year and 2 years postoperatively
secondary_outcome.description: HOOS consists of 5 subscales; Pain, other Symptoms, Function in daily living (ADL), Function in sport and recreation (Sport/Rec) and hip related Quality of life (QOL). The last week is taken into consideration when answering the questions. Standardized answer options are given (5 Likert boxes) and each question gets a score from 0 to 4. A normalized score (100 indicating no symptoms and 0 indicating extreme symptoms) is calculated for each subscale.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: pre-operatively, 6 weeks, 3 months, 6 months, 1 year and 2 years postoperatively
secondary_outcome.description: WOMAC Score presented in Pain (range 0-20), Stiffness (range 0-8) and Function (range 0-68) component Higher scores on the WOMAC indicate worse pain, stiffness, and functional limitations.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: pre-operatively, 6 weeks, 3 months, 6 months, 1 year and 2 years postoperatively
secondary_outcome.description: Western Ontario and McMaster Osteoarthritis Index (WOMAC) presented in Pain (range 0-20), Stiffness (range 0-8) and Function (range 0-68) component. Higher scores on the WOMAC indicate worse pain, stiffness, and functional limitations.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: pre-operatively, 6 weeks, 3 months, 6 months, 1 year and 2 years postoperatively
secondary_outcome.description: WOMAC Score presented in Pain (range 0-20), Stiffness (range 0-8) and Function (range 0-68) component. Higher scores on the WOMAC indicate worse pain, stiffness, and functional limitations.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: pre-operatively, 6 weeks, 3 months, 6 months, 1 year and 2 years postoperatively
secondary_outcome.description: 12-Item Short-Form Health Survey (SF-12) presented in Physical (PS) and Mental summary (MS) scores (range 0-100). A zero score indicates the lowest level of health and 100 indicates the highest level of health.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: pre-operatively, 6 weeks, 3 months, 6 months, 1 year and 2 years postoperatively
secondary_outcome.description: SF-12 Score presented in Physical and Mental summary scores (range 0-100). A zero score indicates the lowest level of health and 100 indicates the highest level of health.

arm_group.description: 25 patients will have the Stanmore prosthesis
25 patients will have the Metaphyseal Hip Prosthesis (MHP) prosthesis

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Candidates for a total hip replacement because of arthritis of the hip
- Patients with a good general condition
- Patients willing and able to participate in the clinical trial with a 10 years follow up and who have signed an inform consent
- Males and females
- Age between 55 and 75
- Absence or little presence of osteoporotic bone (t>-2)
- ASA score 1 and 2
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patient with co morbidities that limit the physical abilities which may negatively influence the scores. Such co morbidities can for example be cardiac insufficiency or chronic respiratory diseases.
- Severe systematic diseases such as rheumatic arthritis and SLE.
- General osteoporosis (t<-2).
- Hormonal conditions such as Paget disease, which reduces the bone density.
- Diseases that can negatively influence the 10 years life expectancy.
- Chronic use of corticosteroids.
- Extreme overweight defined as BMI above 35.
- Active bacterial infection.
- Mental weakness which could negatively influence the postoperative recovery and influence the ability to complete pain scores and other questionnaires.
- ASA score >2.

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Participants were recruited from all patients eligible for a total hip replacement from either of the investigators at the Bravis Hospital in Roosendaal, between October 2012 and October 2013.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Pre-operatively a DEXA scan was made to confirm eligibility.

group.title: MHP Hip Stem
group.description: Cemented MHP (Metaphyseal Hip Prosthesis) hip stem

participants_list.participants: 1 patient terminated due to stem revision
2 patients terminated due to stem revision
1 patient terminated due to stem revision

measure.title: Race and Ethnicity Not Collected
measure.population: Race and Ethnicity were not collected from any participant.

outcome.title: RSA Translation X
outcome.description: Stem movement measured with RSA (radiostereometric analysis) along the x-axis in mm. RSA is a technique to accurately measure 3D movement of the prosthesis in the bone. The movement is measured with respect to the situation directly postoperative.
outcome.time_frame: 3 months, 6 months, 1 year and 2 years postoperatively
outcome.population: The population analyzed included all participants with a valid RSA baseline X-ray taken direct postoperatively and with a valid RSA X-ray at the respective time interval. Analysis was performed based on per protocol treatment.

outcome.description: HOOS (Hip disability and Osteoarthritis Outcome Score) consists of 5 subscales; Pain, other Symptoms, Function in daily living (ADL), Function in sport and recreation (Sport/Rec) and hip related Quality of life (QOL). The last week is taken into consideration when answering the questions. Standardized answer options are given (5 Likert boxes) and each question gets a score from 0 to 4. A normalized score (100 indicating no symptoms and 0 indicating extreme symptoms) is calculated for each subscale.

outcome.population: The population analyzed included all participants with surgery as part of the study. Analysis was performed based on per protocol treatment. Analysis of the HOOS Score was performed for all valid completed score forms.

group.description: Cemented MHP (Metaphyseal Hip Prosthesis) hip stem

event.sub_title: Pain in groin During Weigth Bearing

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: The enrollment was terminated early leading to a small number of patients available for analysis.
